key_findings: December 2025 marked a surge in zero-day exploitation with CVSS 10.0 vulnerabilities actively exploited
AI-driven phishing campaigns increased 1,265% YoY with OAuth device-code flow abuse
Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platforms lowered barrier to entry for threat actors
State-sponsored APT groups rapidly exploiting React2Shell and Cisco AsyncOS vulnerabilities
Holiday season phishing and credential theft campaigns at peak intensity
executive_summary.business_impact: CRITICAL - Organizations face coordinated, multi-vector attacks combining zero-days, AI-enhanced social engineering, and supply chain exploitation

affected_systems: Web applications using React Server Components
threats.description: Unauthenticated remote code execution in React Server Components allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code with a single crafted HTTP request
indicatorsOfCompromise: HTTP POST requests to React RSC endpoints with malicious payloads
Node.js process spawning unusual child processes
recommendedActions: IMMEDIATE: Upgrade React to patched version (19.x+)
IMMEDIATE: Upgrade Next.js to 15.x+ or 16.x+ with patches
Implement WAF rules to detect React RSC exploitation attempts
Monitor for reconnaissance commands in application logs
Block known threat actor IP addresses at perimeter
Conduct code review for RSC implementations
Enable enhanced logging for HTTP POST requests to RSC endpoints
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Affects modern web applications; exploitation enables full system compromise without authentication

affected_systems: Any application using Apache Tika library
threats.description: XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability in Apache Tika dependency affecting multiple Atlassian products
indicatorsOfCompromise: XML file uploads with external entity declarations
Unusual file access patterns in Tika processing
Network connections to external DTD sources
Error messages referencing XXE or entity expansion
recommendedActions: IMMEDIATE: Update Atlassian products to patched versions
Disable XML external entity processing in Tika
Implement input validation for XML uploads
Monitor for XXE exploitation attempts in logs
Restrict outbound network connections from application servers
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Affects enterprise collaboration platforms; XXE can lead to data exfiltration and RCE

threats.description: Remote code execution vulnerabilities in Microsoft Office components exploitable via malicious emails or links without user interaction
indicatorsOfCompromise: Malicious Office documents with type confusion or use-after-free exploits
Office process spawning unusual child processes
Registry modifications related to Office security settings
recommendedActions: IMMEDIATE: Apply Microsoft December 2025 security patches
Deploy email gateway filtering for Office documents
Disable Office macros via Group Policy
Implement application whitelisting for Office processes
Monitor Office process execution for anomalies
Conduct user awareness training on malicious attachments
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Widespread attack surface; affects all organizations using Microsoft Office

affected_systems: Cisco Secure Email and Web Manager
threats.description: Maximum-severity zero-day enabling arbitrary command execution with root privileges on Cisco email security appliances
indicatorsOfCompromise: Brute-force login attempts from 10,000+ unique IPs
Automated login attempts to GlobalProtect portals
recommendedActions: IMMEDIATE: Apply Cisco security patches
URGENT: Restrict internet-exposed ports on email appliances
Implement strong authentication (MFA) for appliance access
Monitor for brute-force login attempts
Review appliance logs for unauthorized access
Implement network segmentation for email infrastructure
CISA deadline: Federal agencies must mitigate by 2025-12-24
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Email security appliances are high-value targets; compromise enables email interception and lateral movement

threats.threat_name: OAuth Device Code Flow Abuse - Microsoft 365 Account Takeover
threats.description: Large-scale phishing campaigns exploiting OAuth 2.0 device code authorization flow to compromise Microsoft 365 accounts, resulting in account takeover, data exfiltration, and lateral movement
attack_chain: 1. Phishing email with device code authorization link
2. Victim visits malicious OAuth consent page
3. Attacker obtains device code and user code
4. Attacker exchanges codes for access token
indicatorsOfCompromise: Phishing emails with OAuth device code links
Suspicious Microsoft 365 sign-in from unusual locations
Forwarding rules created in compromised mailboxes
Data exfiltration to external cloud storage
Lateral movement to other cloud services
recommendedActions: IMMEDIATE: Deploy conditional access policies blocking device code flow from untrusted locations
Enable MFA for all Microsoft 365 accounts
Implement email gateway filtering for OAuth phishing links
Monitor for suspicious OAuth consent requests
Review and revoke suspicious app permissions
Conduct user awareness training on OAuth phishing
Implement FIDO2 security keys for high-value accounts
Monitor mailbox forwarding rules for anomalies
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Cloud account compromise enables data theft, lateral movement, and persistence; affects government and enterprise sectors

threats.description: Large-scale BEC campaigns impersonating executive coaching firms, targeting finance teams with requests for ACH/wire transfers
threats.campaign_scale: 496 confirmed engagements, millions of emails monthly
attack_chain: 1. Spoofed email from fake executive coaching firm
3. Request for urgent ACH or wire transfer
4. Use of 'mule' accounts for fund transfers
indicatorsOfCompromise: Emails from free email providers impersonating executives
Requests to bypass normal approval processes
recommendedActions: Implement email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC)
Deploy advanced email filtering with AI-based anomaly detection
Implement payment approval workflows with multi-factor verification
Conduct user awareness training on BEC tactics
Verify wire transfer requests through out-of-band communication
Monitor for unusual payment patterns
Implement transaction limits and approval thresholds
threats.business_context: HIGH - Direct financial impact; affects all organizations with finance operations

threats.description: Most prevalent ransomware strain in Q3 2025, responsible for 34% of observed attacks; employs double/triple extortion tactics
indicatorsOfCompromise: Lateral movement via PSExec or similar tools
recommendedActions: Implement segmentation to limit lateral movement
Deploy EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response) solutions
Maintain offline backups of critical data
Implement application whitelisting
Monitor for suspicious network activity
Disable unnecessary network services
Implement MFA for remote access
Conduct incident response tabletop exercises
threats.business_context: CRITICAL - Widespread threat; double/triple extortion increases pressure on victims to pay

threats.description: Infostealer malware operating as Malware-as-a-Service; targets PII, credentials, banking info, cookies, and cryptocurrency wallets
recommendedActions: Deploy credential guard on Windows systems
Implement browser isolation for high-risk users
Monitor for suspicious browser process activity
Implement hardware-backed security keys for sensitive accounts
Monitor for data exfiltration to known C2 servers
Implement DNS filtering for known Lumma C2 domains
Conduct user awareness training on malware delivery
threats.business_context: HIGH - Widespread MaaS platform; lowers barrier to entry for cybercriminals; targets financial and personal data
